wikipedia_page.main: Peter Hearn (18 November 1925 – 25 March 2013) was an English first-class cricketer who played for Kent County Cricket Club between 1947 and 1956. He was an elegant top-order batsman who scored over 8,000 runs for Kent and made a century on his debut for the county. He served during World War II in the Royal Engineers and spent time as a prisoner of war.
